sentences: Arthur Green was born in the Philippines, with his father being an American citizen in the United States Military.
Growing up in the U.S., Green would play bass in a few punk bands in the Arkansas area.
In 1995, Green formed Elliot, with Cory on vocals, Matt on drums, and Matt Depper on guitars.
The band recorded Eso-Charis, which was released through Seize the Day Records, founded by Bruce Fitzhugh.
The band would also record a 7" Setting Roots for Winter before Green and Matt Putman quit.
Living Sacrifice reformed in 2008, with the line-up of Green, Bruce Fitzhugh, Rocky Gray, and Lance Garvin.
